required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Subarachnoid Block With Ultrasound-Guided Transversalis Fascia Plane Block for Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Subarachnoid Block With Ultrasound-Guided Transversalis Fascia Plane Block for Cesarean Sections: A Randomized Placebo-Controlled Double-Blind Study

brief_summary.textblock: Postoperative pain management is critical for the fulfillment of the maternal duties. The transversalis fascia plane (TFP) block provides adequate postoperative analgesia in the T12 and L1 dermatomes. The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of the TFP block on postoperative opioid consumption and pain scores in patients undergoing cesarean section (CS) under spinal anesthesia.

arm_group.arm_group_label: ultrasound guided transversalis fascia plane block

intervention.description: ultrasound-guided bilateral TFP block with 20 mL of 0.25% bupivacaine
intervention.arm_group_label: ultrasound guided transversalis fascia plane block

intervention.description: ultrasound-guided bilateral TFP block with 20 mL of saline 0.9%

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged between 18 and 45
- American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical score I or II
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received general anesthesia
- hypersensitivity to the agents to be used
- body mass index (BMI) greater than 35 kg/m2
- coagulopathy
- local infections
- opioid addiction
- pregnancy-related hypertension or diabetes mellitus

eligibility.gender_description: Women aged between 18 and 45 with American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical score I or II undergoing elective CS

reference.citation: Serifsoy TE, Tulgar S, Selvi O, Senturk O, Ilter E, Peker BH, Ozer Z. Evaluation of ultrasound-guided transversalis fascia plane block for postoperative analgesia in cesarean section: A prospective, randomized, controlled clinical trial. J Clin Anesth. 2020 Feb;59:56-60. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinane.2019.06.025. Epub 2019 Jun 27.
Hebbard PD. Transversalis fascia plane block, a novel ultrasound-guided abdominal wall nerve block. Can J Anaesth. 2009 Aug;56(8):618-20. doi: 10.1007/s12630-009-9110-1. Epub 2009 Jun 4.
